history.text: Hi have you ever seen the movie, "The Social Network"?
I have seen "The Social Network" multiple times? How about You?
I have it seen only once
What did you think about the story?
The life of Mark Zuckerberg played by Jesse Elsenberg is really interesting and shocking at the same time. Do you think Jesse Elsenberg did a good job on this film?
Yes, I believe Jesse Eisenberg did a great job portraying Mark Zuckerberg
I think the film deserves its 96% rating of Rotten Tomatoes
Yes I believe the film was entertaining and well made. I always enjoy films based on real people or real events.
What did you think about the lawsuits that Mark Zuckerburg went through?
I thought it was very interesting to see the legal battles that are created that startups deal with
Small details that seem trivial can be just enough to tip the odds in your favor to win a lawsuit
do you think it was righteous the outcome?
This is a story of how someone that does something wrong, ends up the hero and filthy successful, is that right do you think?

Yes, the film deals with themes of morality, but unfortunately business, money and the legal system doesn't care about right and wrong. I don't think it is right in terms of my moral compass but I'm certain this happens all the time in big business and start ups
Do you think his girlfriend dumping him was a factor in how Mark later acted?
Yes, emotion definitely played a factor in Mark's decision making
What do you think of Eduardo Saverin?
he was at the right place at the right time, that is for sure.
How did mark choose the schools to use "TheFacebook" at, was it just the big schools?
Yes, Mark chose to expand Facebook to Ivy League universities
Do you think Mark should've been punished longer for creating Facemash? It certainly lower self esteem of the females rated
Like you mentioned before this idea was so big and became popular it was irrelevant.
Do you think Sean Parker was a big influence, do you think facebook would be what it is without him?
I think Sean Parker had a significant role. His business knowledge and ideas would not have gotten Facebook off of its feet
Do you think David Fincer directed the movie well?
David Fincer is an amazing story teller, I do not know if it could have been done any better, do you?
I am not familiar with his other work but he did a great job, which is validated by the reception the film has received
I do think that films that use the angle of "Based on a true story" do exaggerate certain details to make the narrative more interesting
do you think then that the Winklevoss twins were telling the truth, or wanted some of the action?
I don't think they were telling the truth. After money was involved, they definitely wanted a piece of the action
do you think Mark should have settled with Saverin?

uid2response.feedback: This was an enjoyable conversation, we both have seen the film so we knew the plot.
